newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end down on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end down on profit-taking.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished lower on Thursday as retail investors booked profits on sharp gains during the past few sessions, dealers said.
"We expect the index to remain strong in the near term after today's modest technical correction," a dealer at BMA Capital Management said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index fell 36.88 points, or 2.07 percent, to close at 1,741.63 at 0910 GMT. Losers beat gainers 156 to 81.
Hub Power fell 0.60 to 50.40 rupees and Dewan Salman Fibre 0.75 to 36. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
